general.description: Configuration file for the dARt application sensor system

wifi_settings.description: Configuration for WiFi module to send sensor data wirelessly
wifi_settings.implementation_status: This feature has been partially implemented. The configuration structure exists but the complete logic for WiFi data transmission has not been fully implemented yet

uuid_services.grideye_limitation: Currently, the code in src/GrideyeBluetooth.py is designed to work with a single Grideye sensor and does not support multiple sensors (Grideye_1, Grideye_2, etc.)

multiple_sensors.future_development: For future implementations with multiple Grideye sensors, developers should follow the pattern implemented in src/ConnectedWoodPlank.py
multiple_sensors.reference_implementation: See the get_connected_wood_plank_uuid function in src/ConnectedWoodPlank.py for an example of handling multiple sensor UUIDs
multiple_sensors.naming_convention: The code can handle identifiers like Connected_Wood_Plank_1 or Connected_Wood_Plank_2 by using the number at the end. However, if amount is set to 1 in devices section, use the single name 'Connected_Wood_Plank'

devices.naming_convention: Sensor declaration varies based on their quantity:
rules: For a single sensor: use simple name (e.g., 'Myo_Sensor')
For multiple sensors: add a number (e.g., 'Myo_Sensor_1', 'Myo_Sensor_2')
The 'devices' section declares sensor types and parameters

ports.description: Defines the connection information for each sensor
naming_rules: Must match the amount setting in devices section
If device amount > 1, use numbered names (e.g., 'Grideye_1', 'Grideye_2')

directories.warning: Moving these directories will require changes in the code

filenames.note: For multiple sensors of the same type, output filename will be appended with a number (e.g., 'Grideye_data.csv' and 'Grideye_data_1.csv')

presets.status: This section has been created but not implemented in the code
presets.customization: You can add custom presets here and modify the code accordingly
